INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Possible variations of the anticoagulating effect, with increase in case of acute intoxication or decrease in case of chronic alcoholism (increased metabolism)
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage (decrease of its hepatic metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the allopurinol and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the vitamin E used in doses greater than or equal to 500 mg/day: increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with vitamin E and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Described for warfarin and acenocoumarol.
Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the aminoglutethimide
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with aminoglutethimide and two weeks after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the amiodorone and a week after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage due to direct effect on the coagulation and/or the fibrinolytic systems
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the androgen and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease (or, infrequently, increase with the phenytoin) of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the anticonvulsant inducer and a week after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the Vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequesnt testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist at the beginning of the treatment by the immunomodulator and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the aprepitant
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during and after the administration of the medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cephalosporin and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cephalosporin and after it stopped.

INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cephalosporin and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800mg/day: increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage (decrease of its hepatic metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cimetidine and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin Kantagonist during the treatment with clindamycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the colchicine and a week after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the tetracycline antibiotic and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of thrombosis and hemorrhage accompanying tumors. In addition, possible interaction between the vitamin K antagonist and the chemotherapy
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage due to direct effect on coagulation and/or the fibrinolytic systems.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the danazol and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of causing ulcers and digestive hemorrhage
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the disulfiram and a week after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the dronedarone and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Regardless of the route of administration of the econazole:
increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with econazole and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the fibrate and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the fluconazole and a week after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the fluoroquinolone and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If it is not possible to avoid administering these together, more frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cytotoxic and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the Vitamin K antagonist

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the griseofulvine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the griseofulvine and a week after it is stopped

CLASS.name: UNFRACTIONATED HEPARIN (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENT)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: When the heparin alternates with the vitamin K antagonist, strengthen clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and more frequent monitoring of the INR

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the Vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the Vitamin K antagonist.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Variation of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist, most often by decreasing it
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the length of the treatment

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the itraconazole and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequenttesting of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with levocarnitine and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the macrolide and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of 0.5g to 1g of methylprednisolone administered in bolus: increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Testing of the INR 2 to 4 days after the bolus of mythylprednisolone or in the presence of any signs of hemorrhage

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Unpredictable hemorrhage, possibly serious

Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the vitamin K antagonist, by reason of its enzyme inducer effect, with risk of reduction of effectiveness, even complete loss of the effect, which could have serious consequences (thrombolitic event)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of an accidental use of the two substances together, do not stop the St Johns Wort suddenly, but test the INR before and then after the St Johns Wort is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the orlistat and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage when taking paracetamol in maximal doses (4g/day) for at least 4 days
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during treatment with the paracetamol and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the pentoxifylline and a week after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the pristinamycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the proguanil and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the anticoagulant effect and of the risk of hemorrhage. Mecanism proposed: inhibition of the metabolism of the vitamin K antagonist
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the propafenone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the rifampicin and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with ropinirole and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the vitamin K antagonist
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the vitamin K antagonist (more than 2 hours apart, if possible)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the antibiotic and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the antibiotic treatment and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, more frequent testing of the INR and adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with cotrimoxazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage

INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with voriconazole and a week after it is stopped.
